H0.text: Which French chemist, regarded as the father of modern chemistry, was guillotined in 1794. Antoine Baum√©

H1.text: Which French chemist, regarded as the father of modern chemistry, was guillotined in 1794. Claude-Louis Berthollet

H2.text: Which French chemist, regarded as the father of modern chemistry, was guillotined in 1794. Joseph Gay-Lussac

H3.text: Which French chemist, regarded as the father of modern chemistry, was guillotined in 1794. Lavosier

A4.text: Lavoisier was convicted and guillotined on 8 May 1794 in Paris, at the age of 50, along with his 27 co-defendants.

A5.text: At the height of the French Revolution, he was charged with tax fraud and selling adulterated tobacco, and was guillotined despite appeals to spare his life in recognition of his contributions to science.
